org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io

Class DelimitedOutputFormat.AbstractConfigBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.FileOutputFormat.AbstractConfigBuilder<T>
      • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.DelimitedOutputFormat.AbstractConfigBuilder<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DelimitedOutputFormat.ConfigBuilder
    Enclosing class:
    DelimitedOutputFormat

    protected abstract static class DelimitedOutputFormat.AbstractConfigBuilder<T>
extends org.apache.flink.api.common.io.FileOutputFormat.AbstractConfigBuilder<T>
    A builder used to set parameters to the input format's configuration in a fluent way.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • DelimitedOutputFormat.AbstractConfigBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • recordDelimiter

        public T recordDelimiter(char delimiter)
        Sets the delimiter to be a single character, namely the given one. The character must be within the value range 0 to 127.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter character.
        Returns:
        The builder itself.

      • recordDelimiter

        public T recordDelimiter(String delimiter)
        Sets the delimiter to be the given string. The string will be converted to bytes for more efficient comparison during input parsing. The conversion will be done using the platforms default charset.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter string.
        Returns:
        The builder itself.

      • recordDelimiter

        public T recordDelimiter(String delimiter,
                String charsetName)
        Sets the delimiter to be the given string. The string will be converted to bytes for more efficient comparison during input parsing. The conversion will be done using the charset with the given name. The charset must be available on the processing nodes, otherwise an exception will be raised at runtime.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter string.
        charsetName - The name of the encoding character set.
        Returns:
        The builder itself.

      • writeBufferSize

        public T writeBufferSize(int sizeInBytes)
        Sets the size of the write buffer.
        Parameters:
        sizeInBytes - The size of the write buffer in bytes.
        Returns:
        The builder itself.
